posts.subject: Possible solution for ZeroID's privacy leak: shared ids?

posts.body:
>>b6ccfa2a-5a03-45c5-9498-b71180ce0f9c
>How do you moderate or shut down a ZeroNet zite?

Don't think you can. Glowniggers will probably just bust a few innocent 08channers who weren't running ZN Tor-only, or not running TOR browser and leaking IP information.

If one person posts something illegal, whether MT is active or now, it's easy to say "08chan has illegal content!" and harass normal users. Or at least try and keep normal users afraid of it.

Maybe a moderation company could come up with a "forced moderation" version of the millchan engine that downloads block lists automatically from a central moderation team.

If MT are capitalists or glowniggers they could do something like that. Make a "safe" ZN chan site and fear people into using it to stay legal.

>>9e72408d-603b-430d-aa9e-1b6f08ff0c6c
Well crap, thanks for the input anons. Thought I might have been on to something.

What was the reasoning that they aren't using millchan's "temp id" thing?

The only way I've found to make ZeroIDs maybe securely (without a VPN) is cycling through some of the open proxies on https://www.proxynova.com/proxy-server-list/ until one works for ZeroID. Then returning to regular Tor browser for normal use.

>>8558919f-26ea-40b8-883c-2c5eb3b6ff95
I was able to make it work (or looks like it). Deleted everything that wasn't a directory in ZN and let it create those files as default. Pasted in the above key info into users.json. 08chan let me choose that key and post under it. Deletion is a problem which sucks.
